title: Compute Canada python venv based deeplabcut installation fails to import with tensorflow-cpu==1.13.1 due to bug in tf
body:
**Describe the bug** tensorflow-cpu==1.13.1 fails when attempting to load dlc (core and/or with DLClight=True) inside of an evironment configured to run headlessly. The equivalent GPU environment works as expected. **Desktop (please complete the following information about your system):** - OS: Linux NAME="Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server" VERSION="7.7 (Maipo)" - deeplabcut 2.1.8.2 and deeplabcutcore 0.0b3 - tensorflow-cpu==1.13.1 - headless envirnoment with `DLClight=True` set. - SLURM Compute Canada cluster environment; **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior, i.e.:
Python 3.7.4 (default, Jul 18 2019, 19:34:02) [GCC 5.4.0] on linux Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> import deeplabcut as dlc Traceback (most recent call last): File "", line 1, in File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/__init__.py", line 20, in from deeplabcutcore.create_project import create_new_project, create_new_project_3d, add_new_videos, load_demo_data File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/create_project/__init__.py", line 4, in from deeplabcutcore.create_project.demo_data import load_demo_data File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/create_project/demo_data.py", line 14, in from deeplabcutcore.utils import auxiliaryfunctions File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/utils/__init__.py", line 1, in from deeplabcutcore.utils.make_labeled_video import * File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/utils/make_labeled_video.py", line 38, in from deeplabcutcore.pose_estimation_tensorflow.config import load_config File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/pose_estimation_tensorflow/__init__.py", line 13, in from deeplabcutcore.pose_estimation_tensorflow.nnet import * File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/pose_estimation_tensorflow/nnet/__init__.py", line 16, in from deeplabcutcore.pose_estimation_tensorflow.nnet.pose_net import * File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcutcore/pose_estimation_tensorflow/nnet/pose_net.py", line 9, in import tensorflow.contrib.slim as slim File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/__init__.py", line 49, in from tensorflow.contrib import image File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/image/__init__.py", line 71, in from tensorflow.contrib.image.python.ops.single_image_random_dot_stereograms import single_image_random_dot_stereograms File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/image/python/ops/single_image_random_dot_stereograms.py", line 27, in "_single_image_random_dot_stereograms.so")) File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/contrib/util/loader.py", line 56, in load_op_library ret = load_library.load_op_library(path) File "/home/adt150/DLC-CPU-VENV/lib/python3.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/framework/load_library.py", line 78, in load_op_library exec(wrappers, module.__dict__) File "", line 30 def single_image_random_dot_stereograms(depth_values, hidden_surface_removal=True, convergence_dots_size=8, dots_per_inch=72, eye_separation=, mu=, normalize=True, normalize_max=, normalize_min=, border_level=, number_colors=256, output_image_shape=[1024, 768, 1], output_data_window=[1022, 757], name=None): ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax >>>

```python import deeplabcut # or: import deeplabcutcore ```

**Expected behavior** import successfully **Additional context** The equivalent gpu environment works as expected, with `tensorflow-gpu==1.13.1` and deeplabcutcore version 0.0b3 The environment is setup inside of a python venv, not a conda environemnt. This is a requirement of the server environment we are working in. I attempted to install `tensorflow==1.13.1` as per DLC-CPU.yaml, but pip was not able to find this on PyPi.
